product_metadata.plan_type: Unit-linked, Non-Participating, Individual Life Savings Insurance Plan
product_metadata.risk_disclaimer: Investment risk in the investment portfolio is borne by the policyholder.
product_metadata.lock_in_rule: No surrender or partial withdrawal is allowed during the first 5 policy years.

product_summary.objective: Bajaj Life Supreme (Horizon Variant) is a one-stop ULIP designed to help achieve key life goals such as education, home, and retirement by offering market-linked returns, loyalty rewards, return of charges, and long-term wealth boosters.
key_highlights: Guaranteed Wealth Booster at 7% p.a compounding on Premium Allocation Charges
Return of Mortality Charges (ROMC) at milestones
Loyalty Additions start from 16th policy year onwards
Systematic Partial Withdrawals after lock-in for second income
Settlement Option for maturity payout up to 5 years

plan_variants.variant_name: Horizon Variant (One variant under Bajaj Life Supreme)

core_benefits.details: Fund Value payable on maturity date if Life Assured is alive. Policyholder can choose lump sum or systematic payout under Settlement Option (max 5 years).
Higher of (a) Prevailing Sum Assured including top-up sum assured, (b) Fund Value on death intimation date, (c) Guaranteed Death Benefit = 105% of Total Premiums Paid including top-ups.
core_benefits.guarantee: Minimum 105% of total premiums paid till date of death.
core_benefits.policy_termination: Policy terminates on date of death intimation.

core_benefits.details: Premium Allocation Charges deducted are accumulated at a guaranteed rate of 7% per annum (compounded annually) and added back to fund value at end of 15th policy year.
core_benefits.special_note: Plan is marketed as effectively zero premium allocation charge because deducted charges return back with growth.

core_benefits.start: End of every year from 16th policy year onwards until maturity
core_benefits.rate: 0.25% of average fund value of last 3 years (including current year)

core_benefits.details: 100% of mortality charges deducted are added back to the fund value at milestones.

schedule.every_5_years_after_15: 100% mortality charges deducted in last 5 years
schedule.at_maturity: 100% mortality charges deducted minus already returned

core_benefits.details: Second income option through systematic withdrawals available only after completion of 5-year lock-in period.

eligibility_and_parameters.maximum_premium: No limit (as per Board Approved Underwriting Policy)

premium_allocation_charge.regular_limited_single: Deducted but returned back with Guaranteed Wealth Booster at year 15 (effectively zero)

charges_structure.mortality_charge: Deducted monthly based on Sum Assured, age, gender and underwriting policy.

sample_illustrations.note: Returns at 4% and 8% are illustrative, not guaranteed.

compliance_guardrails.ulip_risk_warning: ULIPs are subject to capital market risks. NAV may go up or down.
compliance_guardrails.lock_in_period: 5 years mandatory lock-in as per IRDAI regulations.
compliance_guardrails.tax_disclaimer: Tax benefits applicable under Section 80C and 10(10D) (old regime). Consult tax advisor.
compliance_guardrails.fraud_warning: BEWARE of spurious phone calls and fraudulent offers. IRDAI does not sell policies or announce bonuses.
compliance_guardrails.rebate_warning: Prohibition of rebate as per Section 41 of Insurance Act, 1938.
compliance_guardrails.misstatement_clause: Fraud and misstatement dealt under Section 45 of Insurance Act.
compliance_guardrails.gst_note: GST depends on policyholder communication address.

retrieval_chunks.text: Death benefit is higher of Sum Assured, Fund Value, or guaranteed 105% of premiums paid including top-ups.
Premium allocation charges are returned at year 15 with guaranteed 7% p.a compounding growth, making charges effectively zero.
Loyalty additions start from 16th policy year and add 0.25% of average fund value every year till maturity.
100% mortality charges deducted are returned at year 15, every 5 years thereafter, and at maturity if policy stays active.
Policy administration charges apply monthly (max ₹500/month) and FMC ranges up to 1.35% depending on fund chosen.
